messages.title: LET'S GET ON WITH OUR PRIORITIES.
messages.content: Better hospitals. Safer streets. Improved schools.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: I'll oppose the plan by the Mayor and Bury Council to build on green spaces, like Simister and Elton Reservoir. And make sure that new homes work for us. That means our communities won't get swallowed up by Manchester.

Bringing empty shops back into use and investing in facilities that you can't get online, like better cultural facilities, restaurants, cafes and sports facilities. That way we can back local businesses on our high streets and regenerate our area.

I'll fight for our fair share of extra resources from the 20,000 more police being recruited. And I'll give them the tools they need to fight crime. Like more number plate recognition to tackle dangerous & uninsured drivers and better CCTV to keep our public spaces safe.

mentions.tacticalSituation: At the end of this election, we'll either get a Conservative majority – or a hung parliament. A vote for Labour means another hung parliament. SNP to back Labour government only with Scottish independence vote.

issues.education: English schools to get three-year £14bn funding boost
issues.health: Government plans billions for hospital projects

housing.content: I'll oppose the plan by the Mayor and Bury Council to build on green spaces, like Simister and Elton Reservoir. And make sure that new homes work for us.

contactInformation.address: Printed by Paragon CC. Suite 4, Fifth Avenue, Centrum 100, Burton on Trent

quotes.text: A vote for Labour means another hung parliament. With Corbyn propped up by parties like the Scottish Nationalists to break up our United Kingdom.
End of the soft prison sentence
